Name: Envision
Definition: Review of the overall strategies and drivers of an organization’s research data program.

Name: Plan
Definition: The tactical management positioning in an organization for effective research data management throughout the research data lifecycle.

Name: Generate/Acquire
Definition: The generation of raw research data, both experimentally and computationally, within an organization, and the collection or acquisition of research data produced outside of an organization.

Name: Process/Analyze
Definition: The actions performed on generated or externally acquired research data to yield processed research data, typically using software, from which observations and conclusions can be made.

Name: Share/Use/Reuse
Definition: How raw and processed research data are disseminated, used, and reused within an organization and any constraints or encouragements to use/reuse. It also includes the dissemination, use, and reuse of raw and processed research data outside of an organization.

Name: Preserve/Discard
Definition: The end-of-use and end-of-life provisions for research data in an organization and includes records management, archiving, and safe disposal.

Name: Data Governance—Strategic/Qualitative
Definition:
The policies, procedures, and processes pertaining to authority, control,
and shared decision-making (planning, monitoring, and enforcement) over the management of data assets

Name: Data Governance—Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Definition: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor an organization’s regulatory [and] legal responsibilities and risks pertaining to data.

Name: Data Culture and Reward Structure
Definition: The collective beliefs and behaviors of the people in an organization concerning the value and management of research data. Practices designed to recognize the advantages and accomplishments of sharing data.

Name: Education and Workforce Development
Definition: Training to provide staff with the necessary skills and expertise for data-related activities and RDM. Includes leadership support and formal and informal training.

Name: Resources—Allocation and Sustainability
Definition: The distribution and longevity of funding to attain and maintain robust research data programs and RDM infrastructure.

Name: Community Engagement
Definition: Outreach and interactions among organizations or individuals with shared goals or interests concerning research data activities or RDM

Name: Chain of Control (Custody of Data)
Definition: A complete, fully documented step-by-step history of a data asset in an organization, i.e., who has possession of a data asset, at what time, and for what purpose, at all times throughout the lifecycle of the data asset.

Name: Financial Aspects of Planning
Definition: Factors to consider in estimating or assessing the costs associated with all research data and RDM activities over the data lifecycle.

Name: Data Management Planning
Definition: The process of organizing and specifying objectives and activities throughout the research data lifecycle.

Name: Data Objects
Definition: An entity that, together with associated Representative Information (i.e., metadata), is produced or used in a research study

Name: FAIR
Definition: Findability, Accessibility, Interoperability, Reuse: a set of guiding principles to support the reusability of data that are beneficial to all scholarly digital research objects.

Name: Data/Metadata Considerations
Definition: Factors to take into account prior to conducting a research study

Name: Data Architecture
Definition: The fundamental structure of an organization's research data management (RDM) system embodied in its components, their relationships to each other and to the environment, and the principles guiding its design and evolution. Includes, for example, the underlying storage technologies, networking, hardware, system interfaces, authentication mechanisms, data brokers, monitoring platforms, semantic interoperability tools, long-term preservation services, and HPC.

Name: Hardware and Software Infrastructure
Definition: The physical and non-physical functional components that collectively form a foundation for conducting research and RDM

Name: Research Data Standards
Definition: Documents, including codes, specifications, recommended practices, classifications, test methods and guides, that describe how data should be stored or exchanged for the consistent collection and interoperability of that data across different systems, sources, and users.

Name: Assessment
Definition: Evaluation of the success of a research project against expectations set before the project has started

Name: Communication and Outreach
Definition: Engagement and interactions among groups and Individual working in similar research areas

Name: Access Control Associated with Data Sensitivity
Definition: Methods and requirements to limit the individuals and groups permitted to view or use protected data.

Name: Data Types
Definition: Classifications or categories of data, each with unique collection, generation, and storage challenges

Name: Data Sources
Definition: Where and from which processes data originates

Name: Generated Experimental Data
Definition: Collection of information through active intervention by the researcher to induce and measure changes or to create differences when a variable is altered

Name: Generated Computational Data
Definition: Production of information resulting from executing a computer model or simulation

Name: Qualitative Data
Definition: Non-ordinal and focusing on qualities or characteristics

Name: Acquired Data
Definition: Obtained from a source outside of the researchers and which was not originally collected for the current research project

Name: Critically Evaluated (CE) Data
Definition: Collected and processed in a standardized way with rigorous methodology to serve as a standard

Name: FAIR Principles
Definition: Compliance with a set of guiding principles proposed by a consortium of scientists and organizations to support the reusability of digital assets

Name: Community-Based Standards
Definition: Technical specifications for encoding metadata for machine processing and exchange

Name: Acquisition Software
Definition: Programs that enable the collection and procurement of data
